bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 1271268 Patch for gschema defaults
The F26 background coloration at bottom right means the white variant of the Fedora logo isn't visible. A simple GSchema defaults change fixes this. Attaching a patch that fixes this in Rawhide + F26.

There weren't any replies on https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1439326, is the Fedora design team behind that change?
(The white-on-nearly-white text clearly doesn't work, but that doesn't imply that we want a text+logo image instead of text-only ...)
It is indeed to point to /usr/share/pixmaps/fedora-logo.png instead of _whitelogo. That's what the design team suggested, see https://pagure.io/design/issue/510 for reference.
*** Bug 1439326 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

(In reply to Paul W. Frields from comment #2) > That's what the design team suggested, see > https://pagure.io/design/issue/510 for reference.
Ah, I wasn't aware of that issue (too many places for filing stuff) - apparently Ryan has similar concerns as myself (https://pagure.io/design/issue/510#comment-437572), so let's wait until we know for sure what icon to use.

Proposed as a Freeze Exception for 26-beta by Fedora user sgallagh using the blocker tracking app because:
This is a low-risk change providing improved visual polish.

Hi Florian, here's the updated SVG (from the pagure ticket) that Sam produced this morning. This is tested to work across all the newly updated backgrounds (we're having the backgrounds package updated too.)
https://pagure.io/design/issue/raw/files/8f36439fb0fb31f3d5f1fd83a3ce57a622e831c4bc52570c4da419d3b4bbdb3f-fedora_blue38.svg

(In reply to Máirín Duffy from comment #6) > Hi Florian, here's the updated SVG [...] > > https://pagure.io/design/issue/raw/files/ > 8f36439fb0fb31f3d5f1fd83a3ce57a622e831c4bc52570c4da419d3b4bbdb3f- > fedora_blue38.svg
Can we get an updated fedora-logos package with that? So far we aren't shipping any artwork with the extension itself (or the package), which keeps its licenses simple ...

Discussed at 2017-05-22 blocker review meeting: [1].
This bug was accepted as Freeze Exception: This would be good to get pulled in for Beta.
[1] https://meetbot-raw.fedoraproject.org/fedora-blocker-review/2017-05-22

I talked to spot and he'll package it in fedora-logos and it'll reside at /usr/share/fedora-logos/fedora_lightbackground.svg
Is there anything else you need for this Florian?
fedora-logos-26.0.1-1.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-34e4f69347

Here's a summary of the packages that will fix this:
- fedora-logos - f26-backgrounds - gnome-shell-extension-background-logo
Here's the versions of those packages needed:
- fedora-logos-26.0.1-1.fc26 - f26-backgrounds-26.2.2-1.fc26 - **we need an updated version of gonme-shell-extension-background-logo** - it should reference /usr/share/fedora-logos/fedora_lightbackground.svg
Bodhi links to submitted updates, both are in testing. fedora-logos needs one more +1 for karma, f26-backgrounds has enough karma but hasn't been pushed to stable yet:
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/fedora-logos-26.0.1-1.fc26 https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/f26-backgrounds-26.2.2-1.fc26
Since these all depend on each other nirik suggested a buildroot override to push them together.

fedora-logos-26.0.1-1.fc26 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-34e4f69347

@Florian, I filed https://pagure.io/background-logo-extension/pull-request/6 with the change needed for the upstream. (The opacity change in the gschema xml is because the SVG on disk has its own transparency built in, this was intentional AIUI.)

This bug appears to be ON_QA but that doesn't seem like the right stage. Yes, we have the new logos and backgrounds, but the actual package against which this bug is filed is still waiting for a fix (see comment #13). I'm moving back to POST because there's a fix posted upstream.
gnome-shell-extension-background-logo-3.24.0-1.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-aa83308938
fedora-logos-26.0.1-1.fc26 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

gnome-shell-extension-background-logo-3.24.0-1.fc26 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-aa83308938
gnome-shell-extension-background-logo-3.24.0-1.fc26 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
